benchmark_details.name: skLEP (Slovak General Language Understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: skLEP is the first comprehensive benchmark specifically designed for evaluating Slovak natural language understanding (NLU) models, encompassing nine diverse tasks for thorough assessment of model capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To foster the evaluation and development of language models specifically for the Slovak language through a standardized benchmark.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Some tasks within each category are relatively similar, and additional NLP tasks for Slovak are constrained by dataset availability.

data.source: Curated from original datasets and established English resources translated and annotated for Slovak with native speaker post-editing.
data.annotation: Manual annotation with native speaker post-editing for translated datasets.

methodology.calculation: Relative Error Reduction (RER) comparisons against a baseline model for scoring across tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted in relation to task-specific metrics, emphasizing a rigorous hyperparameter grid search for each model.
methodology.baseline_results: SlovakBERT serves as a baseline for comparison, with detailed performance metrics across tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive hyperparameter search from training across models to validate robustness.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes Slovak-specific considerations but does not provide extensive demographic breakdowns.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All benchmark datasets are sourced from public repositories and are licensed for academic research.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Predominantly released under Creative Commons licenses and managed for public access upon acceptance.
